content.question: If <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the vector-valued function defined by <math alttext="g of t, equals, open angled bracket, the sine of, open parenthesis, 2 t, close parenthesis, comma the cosine of, open parenthesis, 3 t, close parenthesis, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, then <math alttext="g prime of t, equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

choices.label: <math alttext="open angled bracket, the cosine of, open parenthesis, 2 t, close parenthesis, comma the sine of, open parenthesis, 3 t, close parenthesis, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open angled bracket, the cosine of, open parenthesis, 2 t, close parenthesis, comma the negative of the sine of, open parenthesis, 3 t, close parenthesis, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open angled bracket, 2 times the cosine of, open parenthesis, 2 t, close parenthesis, comma 3 times the sine of, open parenthesis, 3 t, close parenthesis, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.4: (BC ONLY) Defining and Differentiating Vector-Valued Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
